node.title: Big Hospital Chains Drop Vaccine Mandates for Health Workers
node.description: With the federal requirement in limbo because of legal challenges, some major multistate hospital systems have stopped enforcing their own policies.

node.title: TikToker Inspired by 'The Holiday' Seeks to Swap Homes With Complete Stranger
node.description: "Serious inquiries only. Bonus points if you have a hot, single brother," Grace Gagnon posted in the video's caption.

node.title: Teachers' 'Dash for Cash' Organizers Apologize for Event, Donate $15K to Area Educators
node.description: The Sioux Falls Stampede hockey team and CU Mortgage Direct said that the viral fundraiser could seem "degrading and insulting" towards teachers.

node.title: Winter Tornadoes Will Be 9 Times Stronger By 2099 If Global Warming Isn't Curtailed: Study
node.description: According to the study, already rare winter tornadoes also could have longer, wider paths of destruction.

node.title: 12 Children Are Among Dozens Dead in Kentucky as Searchers Look for Those Unaccounted For
node.description: Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear said the ages of those who died range from 2 months to 98 years.

node.title: Senate Democrats Set to Raise Debt Limit by $2.5T, Funding Government Past 2022 Midterms
node.description: Tuesday's vote comes just one day before Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned that the U.S. would hit its current debt limit and face a potentially catastrophic default.

node.title: The rise and rise of Brave Blossoms Kiwi Warner Dearns
node.description: Warner Dearns didn't think it would happen so quickly. Video

node.title: Kāinga Ora to build '42 on King' apartments in Whakatāne
node.description: Plans to build an apartment complex at a former supermarket site in Kopeopeo are back on - this time with Kāinga Ora taking charge of the development.

node.title: Powerful quake strikes Indonesia; residents flee into streets
node.description: A powerful 7.4-magnitude earthquake has struck eastern Indonesia, triggering a tsunami warning, the meteorological department said, but there was no immediate word on any casualties or damage.

node.title: Covid-19 misinformation probe: Three doctors suspended from practising
node.description: Three doctors have had their practising certificates suspended as they are investigated for spreading Covid-19 misinformation.

node.title: Campaign on preventing child sex abuse launched in Coromandel
node.description: A campaign to prevent child sexual abuse has been launched on Wednesday in Mercury Bay on the Coromandel Peninsula.

node.title: How a deaf dancer is inspiring the U.K. to learn sign language
node.description: Rose Ayling-Ellis has reached the final of Britain's "Strictly Come Dancing" despite not hearing a single note of the music she's dancing to.

node.title: Connecting With West Africa’s Plant-Based Past
node.description: Though meat dominates a number of the region’s most popular dishes, a growing number of cooks see adapting vegan and vegetarian diets as a way of embracing their heritage.

node.title: Toyota, lagging rivals, outlines plans to expand sales of electric vehicles.
node.description: The company’s Lexus brand will only sell electric cars by 2030 in China, Europe and the United States.

node.title: Florida Residents Allegedly Cast Multiple Votes in 2020 Election Spanning Several States
node.description: While it is unclear which candidates the defendants voted for, all three are registered Republicans and two seemingly supported Donald Trump on social media.

node.title: Radio message emerges in wake of F1 finale drama
node.description: Lewis Hamilton said over his team radio at the end of the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix that the race had been "manipulated", it has emerged.

node.title: Kroger to end paid COVID-19 leave for unvaccinated workers
node.description: Grocery chain is also adding a $50 monthly surcharge for unvaccinated employees enrolled in its health care plan.

node.title: Casa Dani, From a Celebrated Spanish Chef, Opens in Manhattan West
node.description: A new turn for Brasserie 8½, a bakery from Greg Baxtrom of Olmsted, and more restaurant news.

node.title: For Jazz Musicians in 2021, Two Was the Magic Number
node.description: A host of outstanding duet albums emphasized musicians not only collaborating but truly listening to each other.

node.title: Is Biden’s Presidency a Disappointment?
node.description: Readers assess the Biden presidency. Also: Mark Meadows and Jan. 6; paying for abortions for women in need.

node.title: House Set to Refer Contempt Charge Against Meadows in Jan. 6 Inquiry
node.description: The former White House chief of staff previously provided the committee with thousands of pages of documents, including text messages he received on Jan. 6.

node.title: Linda McAlister, Philosopher and Founder of Feminist Journal, Dies at 82
node.description: She was among a collective of philosophy professors who started Hypatia, the first major scholarly publication to view the discipline from a feminist lens.

node.title: Ukraine Says Troop Call Up is Defensive Maneuver Over Concerns Russian Planning Invasion
node.description: Ukraine's defense minister denied any accusations that Ukraine plans to attack anyone, saying the troop buildup is a defense against Russia's troop buildup.

node.title: CEOs of DoorDash, Pinterest Join Giving Pledge, Say They'll Donate Over Half Their Fortunes
node.description: The Giving Pledge announced that another 14 billionaires would be signing the pledge to donate more than half of their wealth to charitable organizations.

node.title: The Cutest TikTok Unboxing of the Year Involves 4 Paws
node.description: An adorable kitten unboxing video is delighting fans on TikTik with 1 million views this holiday season.

node.title: Americans Who Identify With No Religion Now Account for 29 Percent of Population: Poll
node.description: The diversity in age, location, and race among those unaffiliated with religion is growing across the country.

node.title: Tornado Alley may be shifting east, threatening businesses and supply chains
node.description: Violent storms struck a growing manufacturing and supply-chain hub, causing an estimated $18 billion in economic damage.

node.title: The U.S. Air Force dismisses 27 members over vaccine refusals.
node.description: They are the first members of a total military force of more than two million believed to be forced out over the shots.

node.title: Governments Are 'Overreacting' to Omicron Says Angelique Coetzee, Scientist Who Helped Identify It
node.description: The medic criticized restrictions in response to Omicron, but her comments have been dismissed as "the most dangerous kind of message" and "utter rubbish".

node.title: Video Released of Suspect in Death of Billionaire Who Mused Rival Might Want to Kill Him
node.description: The suspect in the video is described as wearing a hat and kicking up their right boot when they walk. The man or woman is estimated to be 5-foot-6 to 5-foot-9.
